meanings.definition: Convert (a video or audio signal) into a digital format for transmission or storage.
meanings.sent1: I need to transcode this video to send it over the internet.
meanings.sent2: The software can transcode the audio file into different formats.
meanings.sent3: Trying to transcode a video without the right tools is like baking a cake without flour.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to transcode complex data into simple visuals is truly impressive.
meanings.sent5: The magician seemed to transcode reality into a dreamlike illusion.

meanings.definition: Change (computer code) from one format to another.
meanings.sent1: Remember to transcode the code before running it on the new system.
meanings.sent2: The programmer had to transcode the script to make it compatible with the updated software.
meanings.sent3: It's like trying to transcode a message written in English into a language you've never seen before.
meanings.sent4: The artist's ability to transcode emotions into lines of code was truly remarkable.
meanings.sent5: The teacher helped the students transcode their ideas into functioning programs.
